page.title: 02Ripley Past to Present
page.content: The 19th century brought rapid change to Ripley.Local coal and iron mines led to the openinmg of many new factories in the area.This meant that many{new houses}had to be built to house the new population. In 1793 the{Cromford canal}was opened and connected to the network of canals running to Birmingham and London.This allowed the carrying of iron from the Butterley Ironworks and coal,limestone corn and timber. New{turnpike roads}entered Ripley from several directions with a toll gate at each entrance to Ripley.With the heavy increase in modern traffic a by-pass was opened in 1977 and a further by-pass was opened in 1985. In 1974{local government}was re-organised and absorbed into the Amber Valley District Council.
